title: If-Else Conditional
code:
age = 18  # assign value 18 to 'age' variable
if age >= 18:  # conditional check if 'age' is greater or equal 18
    print('Adult')  # if check is true, print 'Adult'
else:  # if check is false do the below
    print('Minor')  # Minor
explanation: Executes different blocks of code based on a condition. Python uses indentation to define code blocks, which is important to follow carefully. In the given example the conditions are evaluated using the operator >= (greater or equal) and the 'else' statement catches all other outcomes (less then 18, including 0 and negative values).
